intro: Callisace dahurica, commonly known as the Siberian bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the cold climates of Siberia and northern Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as tundra and rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in cooler regions.
